value.title: New Artificial Intelligence capabilities in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Power BI Desktop has new Artificial Intelligence (AI) capabilities in the November 2019 release. Sarina Stevens shows us what it is all about!  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/desktop-ai-insights  Connect with Sarina Stevens: https://twitter.com/StevensSarina  Guy in a Cube courses:

value.title: Power BI Desktop And Role-Playing Dimensions: Can you do it?
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick talks about Power BI Desktop and role-playing dimensions. Can you even do this in Power BI Desktop? Patrick shows you why one particular way is not recommended as it will cause trouble. And then show you how you can use DAX within Power BI Desktop to take this to the next level.

value.title: Power BI for report consumers and end users (2021)
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at Power BI for report consumers, or end users. Those folks that maybe don't author reports, but just view reports within Power BI. We introduce some basic Power BI concepts and introduce you to areas of the Power BI service to get you familiar with the portal.  游닉 Become a member:

value.title: Power BI Incremental Refresh - Understanding Detect Data Changes

value.title: To Pivot or Unpivot? That is the question!
value.excerpt: Sometimes your data isn't shaped the right way. Have you tried the Pivot or Unpivot methods in Power Query? They can help get your data looking the right way for your Power BI reports!  Pivot columns https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-query/pivot-columns  Unpivot columns https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-query/unpivot-column

And still have it fully interactive, so you can slice and dice it as you like. 游녤 Download Power

value.title: How to Show Items with No Data in Power BI (e.g. Show All Month Names)
value.excerpt: Sometimes the default behavior in Power BI can be frustrating. For example, if you are showing month names, you may see that if no data is available then those months may not be shown in your Chart or Table. Often, you would want all months (Jan-Dec) to be shown, regardless of whether data is present

value.title: Power BI Pivot: Move Data from Rows to Columns #Q&A
value.excerpt: I am a huge fan of Unpivot (moving data from Column to Rows), but sometimes Pivot is your friend, when you need to move data from Rows to Columns. If you're getting this error "There were too many elements in the enumeration to complete the operation. " trying to Pivot in Power BI, watch this video.
